text: Thanks Colleen, we'll keep that in mind

Good morning! Does anybody have an idea of how one could use URL-parameters to change the content of a page? Let’s say you made a campaign page, and then you would populate that page only with products from a vendor based on URL-parameters.
This is possible with hubl and a if statement with (request.query_dict.FILTERHERE) - then use ?FILTERHERE=filtername in the url.

Hey Guys, Im having a slight issue on a blog sidebar. I want the CTA Module to follow you down the page so im using the Affix set way via Bootstrap2. When it hits the footer I need the CTA to stop scrolling and for some reason I can not get it to stop. Any ideas?
<@U4F337UM8> I can check with my dev team. We have one of these on our home page.

<@U7E7DUNDU> I've been using the fairly new 'position: sticky' CSS property to accomplish this, it might be easier than messing with further JS on a CTA
<https://css-tricks.com/position-sticky-2/>
I do the same as mark Ryba, position sticky with the wildeer polyfill
ooo, didn't know about the polyfill, I just always let it be static on IE. Thanks for the tip!

yea, we tend to have clients that are stuck in the stone age using IE so whenever we are using something that a browser with 1% or greater marketshare doesn’t have we polyfill or find a good fallback.
<@U4F337UM8> Here is what I heard back from my team. Sounds like you might be missing a class <https://www.sitepoint.com/understanding-bootstraps-affix-scrollspy-plugins/>
Also, Scrollmagic can also achieve this pretty easily. You just set the duration to the height of the container you want to follow
That definitely looks like a styling issue. Usually that is due to removing the position relative from a container.

Weird thing going on with emails today

I have a 600px wide image. when embedded in the email it is being resized by HubSpot down to 300px wide then scaled back up to 600px wide using the width attribute and css.

There’s no sensical reason for HubSpot to be resizing the image. It’s a standard image module, the width in the module is set to 600px

There is no css in the template other than what HS injects. It’s as bare bones as it could be.

anyone have any ideas? it’s quite a conundrum
<https://spin.d.pr/F8uqXf+>
Can you DM your portal id and the link to the email?
